attributes.background: Juul was launched in the UK during August 2018; the decacorn corporation has attracted controversial media in the past year and is currently being investigated by the USA FDA. Juul was banned in Israel on 21 August 2018, their health ministry citing serious health concerns.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because we are not sure what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take.

The Israeli ban applies to all e-cigarettes with a concentration of more than 20 mg of nicotine per millilitre. The law in the UK already has such a ban. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/e-cigarettes-regulations-for-consumer-products

You could start a new petition setting out clear what change you would like to see in the law.
